intro: Rhus steingroeveri, commonly known as the Mexican sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like poison ivy and cashew. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically pinnately arranged with serrated edges. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by red, fuzzy fruits that mature in the fall. Rhus steingroeveri is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
